awd_titl_txt: RIA:  Efficient Algorithms for Special Classes of Graphs
awd_abstract_narration: This project focuses on the development of efficient  algorithms  for graphs that have small separators.  The goal is to explore  the  particular topology of the graphs in order to improve the  efficiency of the  algorithms.  One important class of graphs that is investigated is the class of  planar graphs, which arise  naturally in applications dealing with regions in  the plane.  The  following types of problems are addressed:   (1) Finding  shortest paths and distances in graphs:  This is a fundamental and well  studied problem in computer science with many applications.  The problems  considered here include the design of dynamic and on-line algorithm for the  single-source and the all-pairs shortest paths problems for graphs with  weights on the edges;  (2) Locating the center and computing the diameter   of an outer planar graph:  Such problems find important applications in the  design and analysis of communication networks;  (3) Graph separation problems:  Graph separator theorems and the corresponding algorithms are important tools  in the efficient solution of various combinatorial problems.  Algorithms for  finding separators of small cost for special classes of graphs are  constructed, where the cost of the separator depends on some previously  specified cost function on the edges of the graph.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
